text:
A community like this is a gold mine for what Amy Hoy and Alex Hillman (Stacking the Bricks) call eBombs: blog posts and/or emails (to mail list) providing quick and not so quick fixes and answers to problems and questions. Dropping them (appropriately) in forums and Q&A sites can do wonders for list building. And then you can ask your list questions and create even more posts with helpful answers. Which will drive organic traffic and then you have a sort of _perpetuum mobile_, except you'll have to keep engaging your list. Which you want anyway to warm them up for any launches or other sales activities.

All that to say it's no surprise to me <@UJG9WTEKG> would be doing this.

Stay tuned to see what happens :stuck_out_tongue: happy to share our learnings once we... have some, haha

text:
Late to the question here but in case it’s helpful - we created an airtable index that’s tagged with use case & product & such and an engineer built a simple slackbot to search the airtable from slack.

We do have Slack alerts when things go live but my biggest concern is that info gets lost in the stream & even though we don’t publish super often, it’s just easy to forget! And not read everything!

Part of building a multi-pronged approach tho as I think there has to be a lot of repetition & info delivery in multiple channels. I’m still working on grabbing enough time regularly to send an internal newsletter :stuck_out_tongue:

elements.text:

attachments.title: Forget About Traffic and Start Using Content to Drive Leads and Sales - Animalz
attachments.text: Using Google autocomplete to source content ideas is a useful hack, but a trivial one. In fact, nearly all keyword research tools and tips are the same—an impersonal, seductive way to flesh out a content calendar with a very low ceiling. We’d like to propose something new. To be totally clear, SEO-driven content can and... Read more »

We've had varied success with putting hard numbers in subject line vs. preheader. We've also tested personalization in the subject line.

Any sort of urgency usually works really well. :slightly_smiling_face:
